intro: Tetrapterys benthamiana, commonly known as the Benthams' four-winged plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is characterized by its distinctive four-winged leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. Its botanical features include alternate leaves with a serrated margin and a fibrous root system. Tetrapterys benthamiana is often found in moist, disturbed habitats and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
